PageTitle: peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view) (group)
FuncDef:
The peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command sets the maximum duration for a BGP restarter to wait for the End-of-RIB flag from each peer in a specified group.
The undo peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command deletes the configured duration. The peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command sets the maximum duration for a BGP restarter to wait for the End-of-RIB flag from each peer in a specified group. The undo peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command deletes the configured duration. By default, a BGP restarter waits for the End-of-RIB flag from each peer in a specified group for a maximum of 600s.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters. If spaces are used, the string must start and end with double quotation marks (").

Specifies the maximum duration for waiting for the End-Of-RIB flag.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 3000, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: After the local device re-establishes a BGP session with a specified peer group, the local device should receive the End-Of-RIB flag from the specified peer group within the period specified by this command. If the local device does not receive the End-Of-RIB flag within the period specified by this command, the local device exits the GR process and selects the optimal route from the existing routes.
